title: Failed to lookup SourceFile in new context

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (c09a9529c 2021-12-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: c09a9529c51cde41c1101e56049d418edb07bf71 commit-date: 2021-12-23 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` cargo rustc -Z build-std=core,alloc --target x86_64-unknown-none -- -C relocation-model=static -C code-model=large -C link-args='--script=link.ld' --cfg architecture=\"Amd64\" warning: unused manifest key: build Compiling kernel v0.1.0 (/home/yoru/G/Projects/OS/20200324-new/src/kernel) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:500:22 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (c09a9529c 2021-12-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C relocation-model=static -C code-model=large -C link-args=--script=link.ld -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `Arch::Amd64::Memory::Physical::::forward_checked::{closure#0}` #1 [check_match] match-checking `Arch::Amd64::Memory::Physical::::forward_checked::{closure#0}` end of query stack thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:500:22 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (c09a9529c 2021-12-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C relocation-model=static -C code-model=large -C link-args=--script=link.ld -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `Misc::::FromWeak::{closure#0}` #1 [check_mod_liveness] checking liveness of variables in module `Misc` end of query stack error: could not compile `kernel` make: *** [Makefile:17: kernel] Error 101 ```
Backtrace

### Notes I moved the source files between `cargo build`. Maybe cargo need better error handling instead of panic?
